meanings.definition: Binoculars: a device used for viewing distant objects, consisting of two small telescopes mounted on a single frame
meanings.sent1: I used my binocs to see the birds in the tree clearly.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her binocs when birdwatching in the park.
meanings.sent3: The detective forgot his binocs and couldn't spot the clues from afar.
meanings.sent4: Her binocs were like magic windows revealing the secrets of the forest.
meanings.sent5: With my binocs, the stars seemed to dance in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Binocular: relating to or involving both eyes viewing an object at the same time
meanings.sent1: The binocs vision helped him see depth and distance clearly.
meanings.sent2: The binocs effect made the movie seem more realistic.
meanings.sent3: The binocs view made the painting look 3D.
meanings.sent4: Her binocs perception of the situation was impressive.
meanings.sent5: With binocs vision, he could see the world in a new way.
